title: Find First and Last Position
algorithmDescription: Find first and last occurrence of target in sorted array using binary search
detailedDescription: Find starting and ending position of target in sorted array with duplicates. Input: First line has n and target. Second line has n sorted integers (may have duplicates). Output: Two indices representing first and last occurrence, or -1 -1 if not found. Use modified binary search.
hints: Perform two binary searches: one for leftmost, one for rightmost
For leftmost: when found, continue searching left half
For rightmost: when found, continue searching right half
Both searches should be O(log n)
commonMistakes: Using linear search after finding first occurrence
Single binary search not finding bounds
solutionApproach: First binary search finds leftmost occurrence: when target found, update result and continue searching left (high=mid-1). Second binary search finds rightmost: when found, update result and search right (low=mid+1).
testCaseCriteria: Must find both positions in O(log n) time. Should handle arrays with all duplicates, no target, and single occurrence.
